channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Dozens killed in fire at Swiss Alps bar during New Year's celebration
item.description: Swiss authorities say dozens of people were killed in an overnight fire at the Le Constellation bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort.
item.content:encoded: Swiss authorities say dozens of people were killed in an overnight fire at the Le Constellation bar at the Crans-Montana ski resort.
item.dc:creator: Teri Schultz

item.title: Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired. What that means for millions of Americans
item.description: Jan. 1 is the day the extra financial help to buy Affordable Care Act health insurance goes away.
item.content:encoded: Jan. 1 is the day the extra financial help to buy Affordable Care Act health insurance goes away.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Sen. Peter Welch, D-Vt., talks about the future of the ACA as subsidies expire
item.description: Now that the Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Democratic Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont about the future of the ACA.
item.content:encoded: Now that the Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Democratic Sen. Peter Welch of Vermont about the future of the ACA.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Warren Buffett officially retires as Berkshire Hathway's CEO
item.description: The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.
item.content:encoded:
The legendary 95-year-old investor spent decades building his company into one of the world's largest and most powerful. Now Greg Abel is taking it over.

(Image credit: CHANDAN KHANNA)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, Trump administration freezes Minnesota childcare funds after claims of fraud, Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor.
item.content:encoded: The Affordable Care Act subsidies have expired, Trump administration freezes Minnesota childcare funds after claims of fraud, Zohran Mamdani sworn in as New York City mayor.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: Some of the cultural works entering the public domain in 2026
item.description: A look at some of the works going into the public domain in 2026, like the characters Betty Boop and Miss Marple, the first film adaptation of "All Quiet on the Western Front" and many classic songs by George & Ira Gershwin.
item.content:encoded: A look at some of the works going into the public domain in 2026, like the characters Betty Boop and Miss Marple, the first film adaptation of "All Quiet on the Western Front" and many classic songs by George & Ira Gershwin.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Former U.S. ambassador to China discusses the relationship between the two countries
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks to Nicholas Burns, former U.S. ambassador to China, about the current state of relations between the U.S. and China.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks to Nicholas Burns, former U.S. ambassador to China, about the current state of relations between the U.S. and China.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: It's the year's biggest economic buzzword, but what exactly is a 'K-shaped' economy?
item.description: We unpack one of the biggest economic buzzwords of 2025: What is a "K-shaped' economy?
item.content:encoded: We unpack one of the biggest economic buzzwords of 2025: What is a "K-shaped' economy?
item.dc:creator: Stephan Bisaha

item.title: Baltimore's crime rate dropped dramatically in 2025. A look at what the city did
item.description: Baltimore's crime rate dropped dramatically in the past year. NPR's Michel Martin asks Thomas Abt, a criminology professor at the University of Maryland, what Baltimore did right.
item.content:encoded: Baltimore's crime rate dropped dramatically in the past year. NPR's Michel Martin asks Thomas Abt, a criminology professor at the University of Maryland, what Baltimore did right.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Italy makes tiny tweak to its anthem, deleting just one word
item.description: Italy has quietly made a small change to its national anthem, removing a single word.
item.content:encoded: Italy has quietly made a small change to its national anthem, removing a single word.
item.dc:creator: Hosts
